required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study With Two Different Doses of Desmopressin Orally Lyophilisate Tablet With Nocturnal Enuresis
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Phase III Comparative Study With FE992026 in Children and Adolescents With Reduced Night-time Urinary Osmolarity-type Nocturnal Enuresis

brief_summary.textblock: This is multi-center, randomized, placebo-controlled, parallel-group, double-blind, dose-escalating clinical trial designed to assess the efficacy and safety of desmopressin orally lyophilisate for the treatment of nocturnal enuresis "with decreased nighttime urinary osmolality."

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the Number of Wet Nights Between Baseline and Treatment Period II
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (14-day period prior to starting study treatment) and Treatment Period II (weeks 3-4 after treatment initiation).
primary_outcome.description: The number of wet nights was recorded by participants (or their caregivers) in a daily diary. The difference was calculated from the number of wet nights during the 14-day Baseline Period minus the number of wet nights during the 14-day Treatment Period II.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Number of Wet Nights Between Baseline and Treatment Period I
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (14-day period prior to starting study treatment) and Treatment Period I (weeks 1-2 after treatment initiation).
secondary_outcome.description: The number of wet nights was recorded by participants (or their caregivers) in a daily diary. The difference was calculated from the number of wet nights during the 14-day Baseline Period minus the number of wet nights during the 14-day Treatment Period I.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Number of Wet Nights Between Treatment Periods I and II
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Treatment Period I (weeks 1-2) and Treatment Period II (weeks 3-4)
secondary_outcome.description: The number of wet nights was recorded by participants (or their caregivers) in a daily diary. The difference was calculated from the number of wet nights during the 14-day Treatment Period I minus the number of wet nights during the 14-day Treatment Period II.

arm_group.description: During treatment period I participants received 120 μg per day desmopressin oral lyophilisate tablet for 14 days. Participants for whom treatment was effective (a reduction of ≥ 75% from Baseline in the number of wet nights), and who showed no problems with tolerability, continued to receive the same treatment for a further 14 days in treatment period II. Participants for whom efficacy was inadequate (a reduction of <75% from Baseline in the number of wet nights), but who showed no tolerability problems, received an increased dose of desmopressin oral lyophilisate tablet 240 µg for 14 days in treatment period II.
Participants received matching placebo tablets during treatment periods I and II according to the same efficacy criteria as participants in the Desmopressin treatment group.

intervention.description: Desmopressin oral lyophilisate tablet, 120 μg or 240 μg, administered sublingually once a day 1½ hours before bedtime.
Placebo oral lyophilisate tablet was administered sublingually once a day 1½ hours before bedtime.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed nocturnal enuresis with reduced nighttime urinary osmolality
- Age 6 or above but under 16 regardless of gender
- Out-patient
- Had 10 or more wet nights during the 14-day baseline period and at least 4 wet nights in each respective week
- Deemed healthy by the investigator
- Able to agree to and comply with fluid-intake restriction during the clinical trial and matters specified in the clinical trial protocol
- Consent from the pediatric patient's legally acceptable representative
- Demonstrate an understanding about this clinical trial after receiving an explanation corresponding to the prospective subject's intelligibility
- Show no possibility of being a nursing mother or pregnant, or becoming pregnant
- If under drug or medical therapy other than Desmopressin for treating nocturnal enuresis: able to discontinue such treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Suffer from enuresis with an underlying disease
- Participated in another clinical trial within six months preceding consent
- Used an intranasal Desmopressin in the past
- Presently undergoing a systemic antibiotic treatment, a treatment with an antidiuretic or a drug that affects urinary concentration, or a drug or medical therapy for overactive bladder
- Have an anomaly or a disease that may affect the oral absorption of drug products
- Hard to get cooperation from subject by school refusal, punishment or bullying
- Deemed by the investigator to be inappropriate to participate in this trial
- Unable to be placed on water-intake restriction starting from two hours before bedtime
- Evidence of hepatic, renal, cardiac, or pulmonary dysfunction

facility.name: Hiroshima Red Cross Hospital and Atomic Bomb Survivors Hospital

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 174 subjects consented and entered the 14-day screening period during which Baseline characteristics regarding enuretic episodes were established. Eligible patients who met the criterion were randomized 1:1 to receive either desmopressin or matching placebo. Randomization was stratified by gender, age and number of wet nights at Baseline.

group.title: Desmopressin
group.description: During treatment period I participants received 120 μg per day desmopressin oral lyophilisate tablet for 14 days. Participants for whom treatment was effective (a reduction of ≥ 75% from Baseline in the number of wet nights), and who showed no problems with tolerability, continued to receive the same treatment for a further 14 days in treatment period II. Participants for whom efficacy was inadequate (a reduction of <75% from Baseline in the number of wet nights), but who showed no tolerability problems, received an increased dose of desmopressin oral lyophilisate tablet 240 µg for 14 days in treatment period II.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received matching placebo tablets during treatment periods I and II according to the same efficacy criteria as participants in the Desmopressin treatment group.

participants_list.participants: One patient was excluded from the full analysis set due to failure to satisfy the entry criteria.
Desmopressin 120 µg - 4 participants Desmopressin 240 µg - 41 participants
One patient was excluded from the full analysis set due to failure to satisfy the entry criteria.

group.title: Desmopressin
group.description: During treatment period I participants received 120 μg per day desmopressin oral lyophilisate tablet for 14 days. Participants for whom treatment was effective (a reduction of ≥ 75% from Baseline in the number of wet nights), and who showed no problems with tolerability, continued to receive the same treatment for a further 14 days in treatment period II. Participants for whom efficacy was inadequate (a reduction of <75% from Baseline in the number of wet nights), but who showed no tolerability problems, received an increased dose of desmopressin oral lyophilisate tablet 240 µg for 14 days in treatment period II.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received matching placebo tablets during treatment periods I and II according to the same efficacy criteria as participants in the Desmopressin treatment group.

measure.title: Number of Wet Nights during Baseline
measure.description: Number of Wet Nights recorded during the 14-day Baseline period.

measure.title: Number of Wet Nights during Baseline by stratification criteria
measure.description: The number of wet nights recorded during the 14-day Baseline period is reported for each of the stratification categories.

measure.title: Prior treatment of Nocturnal Enuresis with Drugs
Prior treatment of Nocturnal Enuresis with Therapy
measure.description: Therapies for treatment of Nocturnal Enuresis might include life-skill guidance, bladder control training, psychotherapy, or behaviour conditioning therapy.

outcome.title: Change in the Number of Wet Nights Between Baseline and Treatment Period II
outcome.description: The number of wet nights was recorded by participants (or their caregivers) in a daily diary. The difference was calculated from the number of wet nights during the 14-day Baseline Period minus the number of wet nights during the 14-day Treatment Period II.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (14-day period prior to starting study treatment) and Treatment Period II (weeks 3-4 after treatment initiation).
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) included all participants who received at least one dose of study treatment, satisfied all the major eligibility criteria and for whom efficacy data was obtained.

group.title: Desmopressin
group.description: During treatment period I participants received 120 μg per day desmopressin oral lyophilisate tablet for 14 days. Participants for whom treatment was effective (a reduction of ≥ 75% from Baseline in the number of wet nights), and who showed no problems with tolerability, continued to receive the same treatment for a further 14 days in treatment period II. Participants for whom efficacy was inadequate (a reduction of <75% from Baseline in the number of wet nights), but who showed no tolerability problems, received an increased dose of desmopressin oral lyophilisate tablet 240 µg for 14 days in treatment period II.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received matching placebo tablets during treatment periods I and II according to the same efficacy criteria as participants in the Desmopressin treatment group.

measure.title: Change in the Number of Wet Nights Between Baseline and Treatment Period II
measure.description: The number of wet nights was recorded by participants (or their caregivers) in a daily diary. The difference was calculated from the number of wet nights during the 14-day Baseline Period minus the number of wet nights during the 14-day Treatment Period II.
measure.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) included all participants who received at least one dose of study treatment, satisfied all the major eligibility criteria and for whom efficacy data was obtained.

analysis.p_value_desc: Desmopressin was considered to be superior to Placebo if the p-value for the comparison was < 0.05 and the reduction from Baseline in number of wet nights was larger in the FE992026 group than in the Placebo group.
analysis.method_desc: Factors in the analysis were Gender (male, female), age (6≤x≤9, 10≤x≤15), number of wet nights at Baseline (10≤x≤13, x=14), and treatment group.

outcome.title: Change in Number of Wet Nights Between Baseline and Treatment Period I
outcome.description: The number of wet nights was recorded by participants (or their caregivers) in a daily diary. The difference was calculated from the number of wet nights during the 14-day Baseline Period minus the number of wet nights during the 14-day Treatment Period I.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review the draft manuscript prior to publication and can request delay of publication where any contents are deemed patentable by the sponsor or confidential to the sponsor. Comments will be given within four weeks from receipt of the draft manuscript. Additional time may be required to allow Ferring to seek patent protection of the invention
